subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Idioms of {{lang|ja|酢}}}}
* {{ja-r|酢が過ぎる|す が すぎる}}: “vinegar is excessive, too much vinegar” → doing too much, being excessive
* {{ja-r|酢でさいて飲む|す で さいて のむ}}: “cutting something with vinegar and swallowing it down” → in reference with the ease of cutting a fish, dipping it in vinegar, and eating it: doing something very simple
* {{ja-r|酢でも酒塩でも|す で も さかしお で も}}, {{ja-r|酢でも蒟蒻でも|す で も こんにゃく で も}}: {{sense|used with a negative verb}} “by vinegar or by cooking wine”, “by vinegar or by [[konjac]]” → something that cannot be done in the usual fashion, or cannot be done easily
* {{ja-r|酢に当て粉に当て|す に あて こ に あて}}, {{ja-r|酢につけ粉につけ|す に つけ こ に つけ}}: “with regard to vinegar and flour”, “about vinegar and flour” → about something, about various things; from time to time
* {{ja-r|酢にも粉にも|す に も こ に も}}, {{ja-r|酢にも塩にも|す に も しお に も]}}, {{ja-r|酢にも蛸にも|す に も たこ に も}}, {{ja-r|酢にも味噌にも|す に も みそ に も}}: “about/in vinegar and flour”, “about/in vinegar and salt”, “about/in vinegar and octopus”, “about/in vinegar and miso” → about anything, in anything
* {{ja-r|酢の粉の|す の こ の}}, {{ja-r|酢の蒟蒻の|す の こんにゃく の}}: “of vinegar, of flour”, “of vinegar, of [[konjac]]” → of anything, belonging to anything
* {{ja-r|酢を買う|す を かう}}, {{ja-r|酢を乞う|す を こ.う}}: “to buy vinegar”, “to beg vinegar” → to lose [[goodwill]] through excessive [[sycophancy]], to anger someone by saying more than one should; to [[agitate]] or [[instigate]], to stir things up
{{der-bottom}}
